title: Print, 1748
medium: Etching in black ink on off-white laid paper
signed: In plate below image at left: J.V. del. Scu.
inscribed:
In black ink in plate below plate mark at left: J.V. del. Scu.
Inscribed across lower margin: Bacha de Caramanie 7
provenance: Purchased in memory of Eleanor Garnier Hewitt
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor G. Hewitt
description: Bearded man in Turkish costume leans (or sits) on wall with landscape beyond. His left hand is open on his knee, palm up and index finger and thumb extended. He wears large plumed and jewled turban. Below, the title and artist's initials.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, 1748.
1748. Etching in black ink on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor G. Hewitt. 1962-195-21.
